intro: Sibangea pleioneura, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sibangea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often with a contrasting throat. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
